item.title: "Uber for Knowledge" Augur Teams Up With Blockchain Security Experts
item.description:
"Uber for Knowledge" Augur Teams Up With Blockchain Security Experts

It will enable a highly secure and user-friendly account creation process, along with automatic encryption, backup and synchronization that will make Augur feel like a traditional website for the end-user. This solution could be the world's first for interacting with blockchains.

item.title: U.S. Election Puts $1,000 Bitcoin Within Reach
item.description:
U.S. Election Puts $1,000 Bitcoin Within Reach

In my now bi-weekly look at Bitcoin I tend to focus on the news rather than the price. Bitcoin is a long-term challenge to banking and even money as we know it, and I have felt that progress in terms of recognition and understanding is more important than the vagaries of the market.

item.title: The DAO Will Give Birth To the Companies That Otherwise Wouldn't Have Existed: Interview with Co-Founder of Slock.it
item.description:
The DAO Will Give Birth To the Companies That Otherwise Wouldn't Have Existed: Interview with Co-Founder of Slock.it

May 28, the crowdsale of The DAO, an ambitious project for decentralized trust management on the blockchain of Ethereum, has closed. The project, initiated by Slock.it, a startup producing smart locks, has got more than 12 million Ethers, which is worth of almost $165 million.

item.title: Almost 33 Million Twitter Passwords Stolen and Put Up for Sale for Bitcoins
item.description:
Almost 33 Million Twitter Passwords Stolen and Put Up for Sale for Bitcoins

Information security website Leaked Source has announced that a database containing upwards of 32.8 million stolen Twitter passwords has popped up on the darkweb. The experts noted that the data had been stolen directly from users, most of whom use Russia-based services.

item.title: Tendermint Suggested an Alternative Approach for Blockchain Systems Scaling
item.description:
Tendermint Suggested an Alternative Approach for Blockchain Systems Scaling

Jae Kwon and Ethan Buchman from Tendermint are developing a new architecture to solve the scalability problem found in blockchain systems. The researchers use the practical experience of such systems as thereum, Bitcoin, and Zerocash.

item.title: What is the safest bitcoin hardware wallet, a Trezor or cold storage a paper wallet and why?
item.description:
What is the safest bitcoin hardware wallet, a Trezor or cold storage a paper wallet and why?

Answer (1 of 5): They are both quite good. Paper Wallet * Security: A paper wallet (with strong passphrase!) is extremely secure if you manage to create it on an offline computer and secure printer and are 100% certain that no data remains afterwards (check the spool file in the printer?

item.title: How could blockchain make financial crises less damaging?
item.description:
How could blockchain make financial crises less damaging?

Answer: I doubted. The core reason for any economic/financial crisis is mismanagement. People often blame governments, banks, masons, etc., but in many cases, no power and no brain on Earth can manage such a complex system as billions of people trading between each other more or less chaotically....

item.title: What crucial aspects need to have an autonomous company to be successfully? (Implemented in Ethereum similar to TheDAO)
item.description:
What crucial aspects need to have an autonomous company to be successfully? (Implemented in Ethereum similar to TheDAO)

One day, during my (now Ex) husband's 2nd or 3rd deployment to Iraq ( I forget, he did 4 before his medical discharge) one of our children showed me a picture he drew at school. It was a stick figure drawing of our family.

item.title: Male Contraceptive Project Loses $13,000 Bitcoin Donation Because of Payment Limit
item.description:
Male Contraceptive Project Loses $13,000 Bitcoin Donation Because of Payment Limit

Experimental male contraceptive project Vasalgel received a Bitcoin donation valued at $13,000 last month. Unfortunately, the donation was declined and sent back by Vasalgel's payment processor. Via a Facebook post, Vasalgel announced the failed donation and pleaded with the would-be donor to repeat the attempt: "OMG, someone just tried to donate $13,000 of Bitcoins to support Vasalgel development, but it was declined because it's over the $10,000 daily limit!

item.title: Should the DAO Hire Professional Consultants?
item.description:
Should the DAO Hire Professional Consultants?

Decentralized organizations have a tendency to require much input from very few people, with the vast majority relying on their free and voluntary work. However, as they provide their input due to simple interest, they may be unwilling to take a fully comprehensive and professional approach.
